SEARCH
Package io.github.jspinak.brobot.datatypes.state.state

Class State

java.lang.Object
io.github.jspinak.brobot.datatypes.state.state.State
public class State extends Object
Represents a distinct configuration of the GUI in the Brobot model-based automation framework.

A State is the fundamental building block of the model-based approach, representing a recognizable and meaningful configuration of the user interface. States form the nodes in the state structure (Î©), which models the GUI environment as a navigable graph.

Key concepts:

  • Identification: States are identified by their StateImages - visual patterns that uniquely define this GUI configuration
  • Navigation: States are connected by transitions, allowing Brobot to navigate between them like pages in a website
  • Recovery: If Brobot gets lost, it can identify the current State and find a new path to the target State
  • Hierarchy: States can hide other States (like menus covering content) and can be blocking (requiring interaction before accessing other States)

State components:

  • StateImages: Visual patterns that identify this State (some may be shared across States)
  • StateRegions: Clickable or hoverable areas that can trigger State changes
  • StateStrings: Text input fields that affect State transitions
  • StateLocations: Specific points for precise interactions
  • StateText: Text that appears in this State (used for faster preliminary searches)

This class embodies the core principle of model-based GUI automation: transforming implicit knowledge about GUI structure into an explicit, navigable model that enables robust and maintainable automation.

Since:
1.0
See Also:

      public Region getBoundaries()
      Get the boundaries of the state using StateRegion, StateImage, and StateLocation objects. Snapshots and SearchRegion(s) are used for StateImages.
      Returns:
      the boundaries of the state.

    • getId

      public Long getId()

    • getName

      public String getName()

    • getStateText

      public Set<String> getStateText()
      StateText is text that appears on the screen and is a clue to look for images in this state. Text search is a lot faster than image search, but cannot be used without an image search to identify a state.

    • getStateImages

      public Set<StateImage> getStateImages()

    • getStateStrings

      public Set<StateString> getStateStrings()
      StateStrings can change the expected state. They have associated regions where typing the string has an effect.

    • getStateRegions

      public Set<StateRegion> getStateRegions()
      StateRegions can change the expected state when clicked or hovered over. They can also perform text retrieval.

    • getStateLocations

      public Set<StateLocation> getStateLocations()

    • isBlocking

      public boolean isBlocking()
      When true, this State needs to be acted on before accessing other States. In effect, it makes all other States inactive, even though they may be visible. When a blocking State is exited, the other active States become accessible again.

    • getCanHide

      public Set<String> getCanHide()
      Holds the States that this State can hide when it becomes active. If one of the 'canHide' States is active when this State becomes active, these now hidden States are added to the 'hidden' set.

    • getCanHideIds

      public Set<Long> getCanHideIds()

    • getHiddenStateNames

      public Set<String> getHiddenStateNames()
      Hiding a State means that this State covers the hidden State, and when this State is exited the hidden State becomes visible again. For example, opening a menu might completely block another State, but when the menu is closed the other State is visible again. When this State becomes active, any active 'canHide' States are deactivated and placed into this State's hidden set. When the State is exited and the hidden States reappear, they are removed from the hidden set. StateTransitions uses the hidden set when there is a PREVIOUS Transition (PREVIOUS is a variable StateEnum).

    • getHiddenStateIds

      public Set<Long> getHiddenStateIds()

    • getPathScore

      public int getPathScore()

    • getLastAccessed

      public LocalDateTime getLastAccessed()

    • getBaseProbabilityExists

      public int getBaseProbabilityExists()
      The base probability that a State exists is transfered to the active variable 'probabilityExists', which is used by Find functions. ProbabilityExists is set to 0 when a State exits, and is set to the base probability when it should be found. Having a baseProbability of less than 100 will introduce unexpected behavior into a program (States may not appear when expected to), which can be useful for testing a program with built-in stochasticity.

    • getProbabilityExists

      public int getProbabilityExists()

    • getTimesVisited

      public int getTimesVisited()

    • getScenes

      public List<Scene> getScenes()
      Screenshots where the state is found. These can be used for realistic simulations or for illustrating the state to display it visually. Not all StateImages need to be present. The usable area is the region used to find images. A pattern's fixed region gives its location in the usable area.

    • getUsableArea

      public Region getUsableArea()

    • getMatchHistory

      public MatchHistory getMatchHistory()
      Some actions take place without an associated Pattern or StateImage. These actions are stored in their corresponding state.
